reviewText: Now I have reviewed and attended numerous live concerts, and this one, I consider it just a masterpiece. First of all, eventhough this concert took place in 1992 in Hamburg, Germany, this new special edition DVD was released in 2005, utilizing High-Definition wide-screen transfer, as well as remastered Dolby Digital and DTS surround sound, with multiple camera editing. Fine. But what about the performance? A masterpiece. The original band members were at their peak, as well as band leader Mick Hucknall. The stage presence and musicianship is just superb. This show performance is much better than the "Live in London" DVD, and just as lively and outstanding as the "Live in Sicily" DVD. I enjoy live performances and this DVD does it all. It will make your Home Theater system outshine and clearly demostrate that Simply Red crosses all boundaries and feelings with enduring musicianship. As you can tell, it is highly recommended!
summary: Finally Released in The U.S. - SIMPLY A MASTERPIECE !

reviewText: I ushered for simply red at the warfield theater in san francisco for his 1st album picture book in the mid 80's and i talked to him in person before the show,very friendly and lots energy,i do love his music,Mick hucknell is the versatile artist who can sing various beats from reggae to soul to jazz and to rock,i owned all his albums and his dvds and i know he is still making the best music of his time,owns an apartment in Paris and born in Manchester in England in the jamaican neighborhood where his reggae roots music was inspired,i am always fascinated by his band and their creative way to follow him wherever he goes,all his albums differ from one another,i am glad i met the man and his music,thank you.

reviewText: Excellent DVD! The video quality is amazing, and the sound is as good as the 2007 DVD (Live at Royal Albert Hall). Simply one of the best music DVDs ever.
summary: A Starry Night With Simply Red

reviewText: Here's the actual back cover text and track listing:In January 1992 Simply Red set off on tour. They had just released their 4th album "Stars." In the 14 months that followed, they played 131 shows to 1.5 million people and sold 9 million albums around the world.This extraordinary film captures Simply Red in concert in Hamburg at the peak of their success on this sell-out tour. It features songs ranging from the band's early hits "Holding Back the Years" and "Money's Too Tight (To Mention)" to "Thrill Me," "For Your Babies," and "Something Got Me Started" from the "Stars" album.With 9 new songs not included on the original video version, and newly remastered to high-definition and 5.1 surround sound for DVD release, it also includes exclusive behind-the-scenes interviews with the band's singer, songwriter, and driving force, Mick Hucknall, further interviews with band members and with other key collaborators shed light on the enduring popularity of one of the world's most successful groups.Tracks:1. Introduction2. Sad Old Red3. More4. Jericho5. A New Flame6. It's Only Love7. Band Introductions8. Your Mirror9. Holding Back The Years10. Enough11. Model12. I Wish (Instrumental)13. Let Me Have It All14. Freedom15. Thrill Me16. Come To My Aid17. I Won't Feel Bad18. Money's Too Tight (To Mention)19. If You Don't Know Me By Now20. Stars21. The Right Thing22. For Your Babies23. Something Got Me Started24. Closing Credits
